intro: Spanioptilon lineare, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It is characterized by its linear, evergreen leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are often consumed by birds, which then disperse the seeds. It is typically found in temperate regions and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of forest ecosystems.
